Reviews.Title: “Very nice...if you like this sort of thing.”
Reviews.Author: quin-i-bog
Reviews.Content: We chose the San Domenico House as it is very convenient for Sloan Square which is where we needed to be on this occasion. First impression was "this is odd" as I had to ring the doorbell to get in (at 3pm in the afternoon). The next odd thing was reception wanting photo confirmation of my ID and address and taking a photo copy of my driver's licence. It's lucky I happened to have it on me as I don't make a habit of carrying my passport around in my home country! I've never been asked for this before at a UK hotel...Anyway on to the room; first impression was hot and way too perfumed; easily rectified by asking the staff to take away the 2 perfume diffusers and opening the door onto the small balcony. The room (101 a "deluxe double") was large and decorated in a very fussy, camp style - imagine 1980's House and Garden magazine - all swags and tails, throw cushions galore and gilded mirrors. The bathroom was very small compared to the bedroom, rather basic and had cracked floor tiles and chipped paintwork. The bath side toiletries were San Domenico own label - but half used! There were 2 Moulton Brown miniatures too - but again some missing from one of them. The over fussy touches continued with sprigs of lavender on the pillows and strangest of all a handful of rose petals in the loo pan! We didn't eat here, but I had a pot of tea and some biscuits on arrival which arrived promptly and were very nice. The king sized bed was OK but set on very mobile castors which meant is slid away when you tried to sit on it! The next morning the shower was very disappointing – plenty of pressure but a terrible shower head which drenched the bathroom floor and seemed to miss most of me. All in all I'd rather the management fussed less about lavender and rose petals and provided better TVs with more than 4 channels, upgraded the bathrooms and took away the perfume. San Domenico House is probably a very nice experience if you appreciate camp and fussy decor, don’t mind not having a decent TV, iPod dock or WiFi - but sadly it's not for me.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in fab location”
Reviews.Author: kdw0908
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a 2 night break at San Domenico House. As newlyweds we booked their honeymoon package in a deluxe gallery suite. The greeting on arrival was excellent as was the rest of the service we encountered during our stay. I stumbled accross the hotel on a "boutique hotel" website and we certainly weren't disappointed. The decor is every bit as impressive as the photographs on their website. We didn't want to book just another mass produced chain hotel room and this ticked all of our boxes! Hopefully we shall return for our 1st anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: tarmachead
Reviews.Content: I actually signed up to Trip Advisor to leave a review for the guys at SDH as a thank you for being so nice. I can't understand other reviews criticizing the hospitality. I was very happy with every aspect of my stay but especially by the personal and polite service that I experienced from everyone at SDH. I feel they went over and above their duty and especially what I would have expected. Obviously location, cleanliness, and room were perfect. To be helpful and give a balanced review there was a little street noise (room 101) but nothing major and a bit of noise one morning from the room above us walking around and then being hoovered, but again not major. All in all it couldn't have been better really. I would recommend SDH to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden little gem in Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: JerooPavri
Reviews.Content: This little B&B was the perfect find. After many attempts with boutique hotels in London, we were thrilled that San Domenico House offered large rooms with excellent service and a real "home away from home" ambiance. Ideally located wihin a stone's throw from Sloane Square and Kings Road, what better spot to spend a few days. The staff bent over backwards to help and no request was too much for them to handle. Normally, this kind of service in a big city comes with a hefty price tag.... not here. This will definitely be our first choice from now on for every future stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and characterful base in London!”
Reviews.Author: littleal13
Reviews.Content: If you want to return as soon as you leave then that says it all about this charming and quirky mini hotel in Chelsea. The staff were all absolutely lovely and genuinely helpful, we experienced no language difficulties at all, nothing was too much trouble. The hotel is in a wonderfully quiet and peaceful street, no noise from anything despite our windows looking out into the street, it was very restful. The bedroom was a deluxe mini suite with galleried landing with sofa and table, bathroom was spacious and felt luxurious, overall we had a feeling that we had lots of space. Room service was extremely prompt with a huge tray of tea, toast and preserves priced at £8 for two,would be a bargain anywhere in Europe we felt! The location is perfect, 2mins from Peter Jones/ Sloane St/ Sloan Sq/ Kings Rd/ Tube etc...there were gorgeous restaurants in walking distance - you must try the prawn & courgette linguini at San Lorenzo on Beauchamp Place! Overall, the hotel made our trip very special, we felt as if we had stumbled into a little secret world where we were being looked after!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: SGr4
Reviews.Content: A beautiful and impressive small hotel that is in a great location. The rooms are large, particularly by London standards, with tasteful decorations and excellent furnishings - it certainly feels like five star luxury accommodation. The staff were excellent, very efficient and friendly. I did not stay for breakfast so unable to comment. Only very small drawback is that there is no tea and coffee making facility in the room, however room service is excellent. Useful also to remember that all prices for accommodation, food, room service etc does not include vat so be prepared for 20% onto the bill at checkout. Still great value for money, however!

Reviews.Title: “Italian hotel in the west end”
Reviews.Author: A_brit_in_US
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in the west end. 1 minute walk to Kings rd, 3 minutes to Sloane Square. Tastefully decorated with antiques, pictures galore, and a cosy lounge. Only does breakfast no restaurant. Staff varied. Mostly great but on arrival one night did get funny looks and a request for ID that I stayed there (similar to other write ups) but in this age of security - who cares. Staff helped with tourist arrangements, cars to airports, directions etc. What was a surprise is how Italian it was. Obviously owned by Italian small chain (exclusive) but seem to have Italian staff and a lot of Italian guests. Was actually a pleasant surprise. Stayed in a junior suite, not sure it was worth it but it did have a 4 poster bed and was spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: steviep47
Reviews.Content: I thought I would try something different to my usual hotel in London and I will now stay here every time I am in Town as our stay was perefect. Only minutes from Harrods the hotel offers a really good location. Our room was fantastic, as soon as the porter opened the door it had the 'WOW' factor, with a very comfortable four poster bed. We really did feel like we were at home. The staff were very attentive and service was impeccable. The breakfast was better than many 5 star Hotels I had stayed in. This is a hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: lucyleeallen
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, lovely room (we stayed in a Junior Suite). However, the reception upon arrival was unfriendly, and my partner and I felt as though we were cold-calling at the Royal Family's weekend residence. We went out for the evening, and upon our return we received a slightly better reception, but had to show our room key to prove we were residents. The minibar in the room (no alcohol in sight) charged £4.50 for a can of Coke, and £3.00 for a Mars Bar. Continental breakfast for one person was £14 (plus VAT) and not fresh. Or warm. Really nice room, but not value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Hampshiremum
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here before Christmas with my husband. We loved the spacious room (we took a Junior Suite) - always a bonus in cities like London - my only complaint would be the bathroom, which was small and didn't live up to the standard of the room. Room service for breakfast was good, prompt and of a high standard. When we couldn't get a reservation at the fabulous Indian Restaurant around the corner called Rasoi for our second night, the Receptionist was successful - please go there if you can - the food is outstanding. Lastly, the location was perfect - so convenient for the shops. I would recommend this place and gladly stay there again; however, as we live in the country, and usually go to London for some hussle and bussle, I found San Domenico House too quiet .... which is the best compliment I can give the place because that is exactly why people stay there!

Reviews.Title: “London's Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: ibnBattuta666
Reviews.Content: Where does one start when he enjoyed everything. The property is one of a kind in london. I have stayed in my fair share of hotels and I loved that property. The exquisite attention to detail was unrivaled. I loved the homey feel the room had to it. Location was super ideal and the service was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “A nicely styled hotel marred by slack customer service”
Reviews.Author: insidethesquare
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to stay in for our wedding night as the location was convenient and we loved the style of the hotel. However our stay was marred by the fact that despite booking almost a year in advance and confirming closer to the date the room we had specifically booked wasn't available when we turned up after the ceremony to get some professional photos taken. Unfortunately the photographs were dependent on this room so we never got our shots. A real disappointment on a near perfect day.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: osidekid
Reviews.Content: This was one of the nicest places in Chelsea. The decor and rooms are unbelievable and greatly decorated. We stayed here one night with my brother. Wanted to go back again but pretty spendy. Worth a splurge if you get the chance. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hideaway”
Reviews.Author: dk7402
Reviews.Content: I spent one night on business at the San Domenico House. The location is great - close to the tube but in a quiet side street ( I was able to sleep with an open window without too much noise!). The hotel is very personal with lots of antiques and it feels more like a privat guesthouse than a hotel. Service, though, was impeccable - extremely friendly staff. Since the hotel is owned by an Italian family, most of the staff has an Italian background, which is quite funny in London, but definitely charming. The room I stayed in was very large for London standards, individually and luxuriously furnished (loved the Louis Vuitton vintage suitcases) and very clean. It even had a nice roof terrace which I can imagine to be really nice in the summer. Breakfast in the morning was served either in the room (mine had a nice seating area) or in the breakfast room in the basement, which I thought at first to be strange but turned out to be quite cozy. And they serve good coffee!! Even if I try hard, I can't find any downturns.

Reviews.Title: “excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: dsaharia
Reviews.Content: very nice rooms...good sized. bathrooms a litle small. neighbourhood is excellent and so is the service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel...so central and just across the street from the Underground Station..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times over a period of years and have recommended it to friends and have only gotten raving reviews about the location. What is so pleasing is that one only has to walk across the street from the Underground station to the Hotel. I find that the price is great for the calibre hotel. As a travel agent, I will always recommend this hotel as it is so close to everything.

HotelInfo.Name: San Domenico House
HotelInfo.Address: 29-31 Draycott Place, London SW3 2SH, England
